verses.verse: Surely <WH3588> there is <WH3426> a vein <WH4161> for the silver, <WH3701> and a place <WH4725> for gold <WH2091> where they fine <WH2212> it.
Iron <WH1270> is taken <WH3947> out of the earth, <WH4480> <WH6083> and brass <WH5154> is molten <WH6694> out of the stone. <WH68>

He setteth <WH7760> an end <WH7093> to darkness, <WH2822> and searcheth out <WH2713> <WH1931> all <WH3605> perfection: <WH8503> the stones <WH68> of darkness, <WH652> and the shadow of death. <WH6757>

The flood <WH5158> breaketh out <WH6555> from <WH4480> <WH5973> the inhabitant; <WH1481> even the waters forgotten <WH7911> of <WH4480> the foot: <WH7272> they are dried up, <WH1809> they are gone away <WH5128> from men. <WH4480> <WH582>
As for the earth, <WH776> out of <WH4480> it cometh <WH3318> bread: <WH3899> and under <WH8478> it is turned up <WH2015> as it were <WH3644> fire. <WH784>
The stones <WH68> of it are the place <WH4725> of sapphires: <WH5601> and it hath dust <WH6083> of gold. <WH2091>
There is a path <WH5410> which no <WH3808> fowl <WH5861> knoweth, <WH3045> and which the vulture's <WH344> eye <WH5869> hath not <WH3808> seen: <WH7805>
The lion's <WH7830> whelps <WH1121> have not <WH3808> trodden <WH1869> it, nor <WH3808> the fierce lion <WH7826> passed <WH5710> by <WH5921> it.
He putteth forth <WH7971> his hand <WH3027> upon the rock; <WH2496> he overturneth <WH2015> the mountains <WH2022> by the roots. <WH4480> <WH8328>
He cutteth out <WH1234> rivers <WH2975> among the rocks; <WH6697> and his eye <WH5869> seeth <WH7200> every <WH3605> precious thing. <WH3366>
He bindeth <WH2280> the floods <WH5104> from overflowing; <WH4480> <WH1065> and the thing that is hid <WH8587> bringeth he forth <WH3318> to light. <WH216>
But where <WH4480> <WH370> shall wisdom <WH2451> be found? <WH4672> and where <WH335> <WH2088> is the place <WH4725> of understanding? <WH998>
Man <WH582> knoweth <WH3045> not <WH3808> the price <WH6187> thereof; neither <WH3808> is it found <WH4672> in the land <WH776> of the living. <WH2416>
The depth <WH8415> saith, <WH559> It <WH1931> is not <WH3808> in me: and the sea <WH3220> saith, <WH559> It is not <WH369> with <WH5978> me.
It cannot <WH3808> be gotten <WH5414> for gold, <WH2091> <WH5462> <WH8478> neither <WH3808> shall silver <WH3701> be weighed <WH8254> for the price <WH4242> thereof.
It cannot <WH3808> be valued <WH5541> with the gold <WH3800> of Ophir, <WH211> with the precious <WH3368> onyx, <WH7718> or the sapphire. <WH5601>
The gold <WH2091> and the crystal <WH2137> cannot <WH3808> equal <WH6186> it: and the exchange <WH8545> of it shall not be for jewels <WH3627> of fine gold. <WH6337>
No <WH3808> mention shall be made <WH2142> of coral, <WH7215> or of pearls: <WH1378> for the price <WH4901> of wisdom <WH2451> is above rubies. <WH4480> <WH6443>
The topaz <WH6357> of Ethiopia <WH3568> shall not <WH3808> equal <WH6186> it, neither <WH3808> shall it be valued <WH5541> with pure <WH2889> gold. <WH3800>
Whence <WH4480> <WH370> then cometh <WH935> wisdom? <WH2451> and where <WH335> <WH2088> is the place <WH4725> of understanding? <WH998>
Seeing it is hid <WH5956> from the eyes <WH4480> <WH5869> of all <WH3605> living, <WH2416> and kept close <WH5641> from the fowls <WH4480> <WH5775> of the air. <WH8064>
Destruction <WH11> and death <WH4194> say, <WH559> We have heard <WH8085> the fame <WH8088> thereof with our ears. <WH241>
God <WH430> understandeth <WH995> the way <WH1870> thereof, and he <WH1931> knoweth <WH3045> <WH853> the place <WH4725> thereof.
For <WH3588> he <WH1931> looketh <WH5027> to the ends <WH7098> of the earth, <WH776> and seeth <WH7200> under <WH8478> the whole <WH3605> heaven; <WH8064>
To make <WH6213> the weight <WH4948> for the winds; <WH7307> and he weigheth <WH8505> the waters <WH4325> by measure. <WH4060>
When he made <WH6213> a decree <WH2706> for the rain, <WH4306> and a way <WH1870> for the lightning <WH2385> of the thunder: <WH6963>
Then <WH227> did he see <WH7200> it, and declare <WH5608> it; he prepared <WH3559> it, yea, <WH1571> and searched it out. <WH2713>

And unto man <WH120> he said, <WH559> Behold, <WH2005> the fear <WH3374> of the Lord, <WH136> that <WH1931> is wisdom; <WH2451> and to depart <WH5493> from evil <WH4480> <WH7451> is understanding. <WH998>
